summary: The document comprises payroll authorization forms and memoranda from the U.S. House of Representatives, specifically the Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA), detailing the employment and payroll actions for Johanna Lynn Smith. It includes appointments, salary adjustments, and terminations, alongside a memorandum on payroll certification requirements, highlighting the necessity to disclose any familial relationships to Members of Congress. Reviewed by the Assassination Records Review Board, certain information, such as Social Security numbers, has been redacted to safeguard personal privacy. This document is a segment of the JFK Assassination System's historical records.
key_findings: The document details the payroll records of Johanna Lynn Smith, an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations.
It provides specifics on her employment, including position titles, salary details, and various payroll actions like appointment, salary adjustment, and termination.
A memorandum within the document stresses the importance of staff employees disclosing any familial ties to Members of Congress for payroll certification.
Certain information, particularly Social Security numbers, has been redacted by the Assassination Records Review Board to protect personal privacy.
This document is part of the historical archives related to the investigation into the JFK assassination.
